fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-549].
  {panel}

h3. Current situation

Currently Service Desk has a size limit of 250x100px, but this information is not specified anywhere. If the logo exceeds this limit, the image is automatically resized.

h3. Expected behaviour

Modify the [Branding your Customer Portal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Branding+your+Customer+Portal] documentation to include this information.
fields.summary: Change the "Branding your Customer Portal" documentation to include logo size limits
Customers to be directed to only Customer Portal without the ability to navigate back to JIRA
Outgoing emails from JIRA Service Desk should support plain text format as in JIRA
Disable dates in the past in customer portal
Add links to previous comments
Assign issue to approver and have approver view and approve/deny in customer portal
How-to articles index page capitalisation
Related articles shouldn't include self

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-539].
  {panel}

I'm not 100% sure on the answer to this myself, but initially when I created this KB Space, I expected that the search, label and activity macros would all be filtering at the space level by default.

I think it depends on what we think will be more prevalent:
* People will create one or just a few silo'd KB spaces in an instance with lots of other team, project etc spaces = Should default to restricting them to this space
* People will have instances just full of KB spaces = Should default to side wide

I feel like it's that first option is going to be the most prevalent?
fields.summary: Should the KB Homepage macros be restricted to that space by default?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-538].
  {panel}

*Process:*
# Install Service Desk
# Associate projects
# Create issues
# Disable Service Desk (Kills all issue access)
# Uninstall Service Desk (through add-on option)
# Spend countless hours removing schemes, workflows, roles, etc. from Jira
# Still finding remnants of Service Desk (tables, etc.)

{quote}*If you have a "uninstall" function, that function should TRULY uninstall all parts of that plugin as though it was never there.*{quote}
fields.summary: Service Desk does not completely uninstall all configurations pertaining to service desk.
Display fields in Customer Requests in read-only mode
Enable automatic transition on comment for custom workflows
See the goal as a field
Remove value for optional Date
Filtering in My Requests works just for a whole word - not for entered text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-524].
  {panel}

Sometimes it's possible (due to a project) that you need a new request type only for a few weeks. 

When you delete a request type the message says:
{quote}Are you sure you want to delete the *Get access to a printer* request type?
Issues created with this request type won't be affected.{quote}

This note is not correct. When you remove a request type then the following happens within the customer portal:
* the request type icon switches (random or everytime the robot?)
* all details which are entered fields within the create event are not visible to the customer portal

It would great to have the ability to archive those request types which are not needed anymore and no customer can choose this again or you can re-enable it if needed.
fields.summary: Archiving of request types
Allow variables to be used in fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-519].
  {panel}

h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project with key - COO3
# Access unanimously http://localhost:8623/servicedesk/customer/coo3

h4.Result
http://localhost:8623/servicedesk/customer/coo/user/login?destination=coo3

h4.Expected Result
http://localhost:8623/servicedesk/customer/coo3/user/login?destination=coo3

(!) notice the ..customer/coo instead of ../customer/coo3 

This causes the portal can't be found with *The Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist.* message.
fields.summary: ServiceDesk portal redirection does not parse alphanumeric project key
No way for customer to add a watcher to JIRA Service Desk tickets
As an admin I want to present links as Request Types
Open Links in new tab or window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-509].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour

When you add a comment to a JIRA ticket through a Service Desk project, everyone can see said comment and you can only restrict it's security level after the comment has been made.

h3. Expected Behaviour

I'd like to have the option to change what the default behaviour to handle the security level for issue comments on a Service Desk project.
fields.summary: Improve Service Desk's issue security level
Communications Breakdown Error
Comments order
Improve Service Desk's issue security level
Redirect JIRA's issue view URLs to Service Desk view URLs for customers ( not agents )
Validator when closing a Sub-Task to check required fields in parent Story
Make certain fields read-only for given statuses
Request for Service Desk Notification Guide
Remove 'Give Service Desk Feedback'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-494].
  {panel}

Today when you change SAL configuration it can have dramatic effects about what SLA's are running or not.

For general support reasons we should have a "history audit" of the SLA configurations that are in place at a given point in time.

This would be all the configuration and when it applied.

This could then be used by admins and atlassian support to debug how the configuration has changed and how it should be applied to current and past issues.

Also we could have an issue history record that says WHEN an given SLA configuration was being applied to an issue and when new ones are overriding it (eg when we drop an SLA timer because of a config change)

This would also help for support reasons.
fields.summary: Service needs an SLA configuration audit trail and a issue history of the SLA config that was in play
Provide documentation to help in transitioning JIRA users to the customer view...
Users find it hard to find how to attach a file using the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-484].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When providing technical support within an internal technical support environment (such as Desktop support), it is useful to be able to collect an end-user's IP address to allow for quick remote debugging sessions with a customer. As customers may not have the technical knowledge to manually gather this information, being able to collect this through the JSM portal or the Widget would be a useful addition.
h3. Suggested Solution

Collect the IP address of the customer as a special custom field and include it in the request.
fields.summary: Ability to capture IP information when creating issue
Allow Changing the Submit/Create Button
Change Login Verbage
Normal "Customer" role (not "SD Customer") shouldn't be able to see JSD back office (with SLAs, queues, ...)
Costumer Portal
Check Box Custom field is showing as drop down in portal
Tracking SLA of different groups working on an issue
Create Service Desk Schema
Custom date ranges for reports
Archived versions appear in the customer portal version fields
Service Desk + Confluence Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-466].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The custom templates used for the service desk don't seem to play nice with the mail handler to strip quotes on response via email.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 2.5.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue from email or customer portal 
# Notification is send to the customer mail.
# Then , customer send multiple comment through email.

h3. Expected Results
All previous comment doesn’t include in the latest comment.

h3. Actual Results
Latest comment in the issue ticket include with all previous comment.

h3. Notes
Method one from this link needs to be done in the service desk template, I believe it is in the regular JIRA templates in the same way:
[[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-strip-the-old-reply-data-from-incoming-email-when-using-outlook-223218415.html]]

{panel:title=shipped 2.6.0-OD-06}
Hi Guys,

This will be available in the next release 2.6.0-OD-06.
*Supported languages*
(English, French, German, Spanish, and Japanese). 

*Supported clients*
Desktop Email Clients
* Apple Mail
* IBM Lotus Notes
* Microsoft Outlook
* Thunderbird

Web-bases Email Clients
* Gmail.com
* Outlook.com
* Yahoo.com

Mobile Email Clients
* iPhone Mail app
* iPad Mail app
* Android Gmail app

*Supported patterns*
The below list is based on analyzing reply and forward emails in different languages (English, French, German, Spanish, and Japanese) using the clients above. If a block of text looks like any of the below pattern, then it is the start of a quoted email. However, we won't be able to detect quoted email if the mail client does not use any of the patterns below.
Note: if user accidentally writes some text that is similar below quoted texts, the email body will be cut from that text point.


{noformat}

On date, someone wrote
On Tue, Jun 9, 2015 at 5:33 PM, Admin <test@gmail.com> wrote:

> Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia
> and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in
> Bookmarksgrove

On date, wrote someone
Am 11. Juni 2015 um 10:23 schrieb Admin <test@gmail.com>:

> Ver ver weg, achter het woord bergen, ver van de landen Vokalia en
> Consonantia, daar leven de blinde teksten. Gescheiden leven ze in
> Bookmarksgrove
Original Message
----- Original Message -----
>From: Admin <test@example.com>
>To: "knguyenjp@yahoo.co.jp" <knguyenjp@yahoo.co.jp> 
>Date: 2015/6/12, Fri 10:49
Forwarded Message
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject:   Fwd: Thunderbird 31 hello 2
Date:  Thu, 11 Jun 2015 10:21:07 +0700
Begin forwarded message
> Begin forwarded message:
>
> From: Admin <test@example.com>
> Subject: [jira@localhost] [DEVONE] request 2004 [DEV-72]
> Date: June 10, 2015 at 2:27:01 PM GMT+7
Sent from my iPhone/iPad
Sent from my iPhone/iPad

> On 22-06-2015, at 14:58, Admin <test@example.com> wrote:
>
> hello
Date, someone:
2015-06-11 14:04 GMT+07:00 Admin <test@example.com>:

> Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia
> and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in
> Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean.

{noformat}
{panel}
fields.summary: Email Response Stripping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-465].

Something as simple as a 'Hide' URL on the Customer Portal -> Request Types page near the 'Edit Form' and 'Delete' area.

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-460].

Customer comment on:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Connecting+to+a+Knowledge+Base?replyToComment=587301851&#comment-587301851

{panel}
Jenifer Kuntz
I have Service desk connected to a Knowledge base in Confluence.  

I would like to have more options of blueprints/templates to use along with selecting the fields I want to add to the page. 

Example -  I have an issue type of general questions. I want to create a KB article that is FAQ and brings in the description and the comment, which would be the answer.

Is there a way to do this or any plans of expanding the capabilities of adding to a KB?

Thanks!

Jenifer
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-451].
  {panel}

h4. Use case
We have deployed JIRA Service Desk and we have three queues created such as:
Level 1 Global, Level 2 Global and Level 3 Global, our IT Staff are located in each country around the world and we would like an additional queue called Level 2 Local Support.
Use Case,
A London based IT staff has picked up an issue from the Level 1 Global queue and discovered a Jordan based IT staff would need to visit the user in person, the London based IT staff would reassign to Level 2 Local Support.
Therefore rather than creating a queue per country, we would like the currentuser() logged in to view tickets in the Level 2 Local queue tagged with his/her country parameter.

h4. Example
The JQL query must compare issues custom fields values against the users parameters i.e. country.
For Example, if a user named John Smith located at Nigeria logged into to the Local Queue, he should only see issues where location of the reporter is equal to the same country Parameter as the user i.e. Nigeria.
The same applies for others users located in Jordan, only showing issues logged by Jordan users based on the Current Users parameters.
fields.summary: Create filters against additional parameters
Allow live countdown for SLAs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-446].
  {panel}

For a project which is associated with ServiceDesk, if a user creates a Service Desk Request (through the Customer Portal), then notifications are sent correctly according to [JSD-323|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-323].

However, if an issue is created normally by clicking on Create Issue button (same project) or via email through a mail handler (same project, no matter Default Reporter or recognized user), then the Reporter does not receive any notifications at all, including Issue Creation, Issue Updated, Issue Commented, and Issue Resolved.
(!) *This does not happen when ServiceDesk is disabled*, hence ServiceDesk must have affected JIRA notifications in an unexpected manner.

Please take note that in all of the above situations, Notify me is On for the Reporter all the times. This raises a question with the way ServiceDesk handles notifications to Reporters: even though they *purposely* want to receive notifications for their own changes, they can't.
fields.summary: Reporter does not receive notifications when creating issues without using ServiceDesk customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-443].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+

When you get article results on the Customer Portal of service desk, its showing some of the helper/boilerplate text of the template that only shows when you're editing the Confluence page (but not when you view the page).

h4. +Steps to reproduce+

# Link a JIRA Service Desk project with a Confluence Knowledge Base
# Create a new page in the Knowledge Base, using the "How-to" article template
# Add some dummy text to the article, but don't delete all of the helper text
# Save the article
# Visit the Customer Portal and search for the article just created

h4. +Expected behavior+
Only the title and visible content of the page is shown

h4. +Actual behavior+
The hidden helper text is also shown

h4. +Note+
This still happens in JIRA 7.2.4, SD 3.2.4, and Confluence 6.0.1:
!editmode.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Helper text from article in Confluence Knowledge Base showing up in Service Desk article results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-428].
  {panel}

Users submitting through the portal may overlook articles, or not understand articles that require more technical knowledge.

It would be a huge value to allow agents to see by default any KB articles that match up to the summary (or description <-- too greedy?) of the currently viewed issue.

Even an extra click for performance reasons would be ok "Find related KB".

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/277880/view-related-confluence-kb-articles-on-existing-jira-service-desk-tickets
fields.summary: As an Agent I would like to see related KB articles on existing tickets so that I may more quickly resolve issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-426].
  {panel}

For our clients using service desk, they are hitting an issue when trying to reset their password. Here are the steps:

* Customer goes to the login screen.
* Customer clicks on "Forgot Password"
* Customer enters their username.
* Customer receives the email with the rest link.
* Customer clicks the link and goes to the reset password page.
* Customer enters in password, hits submit.

Normally, a user is then redirected to the login page. However, our client users (which have much more limited permissions) just see the password reset page refresh. If they know enough to go to the login page, the new password submission does work. However, to the end user, it appears that nothing happened and they click the submit button a second time. This throws an error "The reset password token you have provided has timed out".

We believe this is a bug, but it could be a simple matter of fixing a permission. Still, we would expect (given the password does reset) that the redirect should proceed.
fields.summary: Reset password is successful, but doesn't redirect the user to the login screen.
SSL connect error
Hiding SLA details on Issue Viewing Screen
Allow user to define their own Series in the Reports section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-421].
  {panel}

I have a complaint about SLA reports of JIRA Service Desk and I think this should be classified as a bug as I don't want to believe it was designed this way.

The reports tab of JSD service provider interface show line charts about number of created, resolved tickets for past 7 days, 30 days, etc. As far as I understand, report filters tickets based on createddate and resolveddate of the issues. The annoying thing is, if I select a report for the past 7 days and run the report at say ... 10:00 AM, the date filter includes records for the past 6x24 hours. There are two things wrong with this:

1- There appears to be names of 7 days shown on the report but there are actually 6 days on the report (6x24) The first and last days are incomplete. The rest of "today" is not lived yet and more importantly the "first day" only includes tickets after 10:00 AM of that day. This is not obvious for the customers, they expect full days.
2 - As time passes through the day, I cannot have the same report again. Every minute passing changes my report from the starting point, filtering tickets according to a moving point in the middle of the day, so my reports are inconsistent.

The reports should allow me to set beginning and ending dates of reports and more importantly reports must contain full 24 hours for any day shown on report.
fields.summary: Date parameters of SLA Reports are irrational
Permission configuration -Remove user permission to see JSD back office

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-416].
  {panel}

Hi,

We've recently moved our confluence server to a new url with https.

The application links are generally working fine between Jira and Confluence:
* I can create confluence pages from epics in Jira agile
* I can insert jira issues (and run JQL queries) from pages in Confluence.

However, I can't link the jira service desk to the Confluence knowledgebase.

I have deleted the old link (on the knowledgebase tab) as there was no way to edit it. 

When I try to add a new link to an existing confluence space, I can select "Confluence" as the application, but then the spinner keeps turning on "select space" until it eventually returns an error:
{color:red} Client must be authenticated to access this resource {color} (see attached).
The same happens if I try to create a new space.

I've read that this uses the OAuth link (rather than Trusted Application) and I've checked the config there and everything looks fine - 2-legged auth (and impersonation) are enabled, and there are no warnings.

What am I doing wrong?

thanks,
Mark.
fields.summary: Unable to access Confluence Knowledgbase from Jira Service Desk
Group restriction on SLA details in JIRA ticket
Jira Chart gadgets should be able to handle SLA fields
Adding the Feature to Generate A Total Life Cycle for an Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-411].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

* Change the project key regexp to ([A-z0-9]+) 
* Create a service desk containing a digit (e.g. 3abc)
* Log out and access http://localhost:8620/servicedesk/customer/3abc 
* You'll get a return of 310 - ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS.
* When logged in as an authorized user, the problem does not show up.

{code}

(!) According to our supported project key formats, changing the project key to start with a number is not supported however: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format

This is therefore a trivial bug
fields.summary: Accessing Service Desk anonomously with a changed project key causes "Too Many Redirects"
Provide a reference or link to a Customer Portal request from the associated JIRA issue
Jira Service Desk. Error with license update
Jira Service Desk. Can't update the licence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-404].
  {panel}

There is the little queue change "update" on the top right of the queue, but why the queue could not update live?

Instead of showing this shy warning message, that blend in the graphics, add the issue directly in the list. 

Or make an option so that it'll do it. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Queue Should Have an option to Auto Update
Customer Portal date custom field is not filled in with the default value.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-402].

*4 Jan 2022 Update:*

*Hi all!* 

*The rollout of ProForma (Forms for Jira) is now in progress and should be available to all customers in the next few weeks.* 

*Regards,*

*Simon Herd*

*Principal Product Manager, Jira Service Management*
{panel}
 

We have six forms, each with a 1-3 sentence description. There is a lot of whitespace on the left and right, but our users have to scroll down to see all of the forms on certain resolutions/screen sizes. We would like to be able to put our forms into 2 or 3 columns.
fields.summary: Create ability to display Forms in columns
Under "You can" when viewing an issue in Customer Portal, add link for "Add attachment"
Need a help merging multiple AoD accounts.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-398].
  {panel}

Currently, users can configure SLA's based on Priorities, whereby once the priority is changed to another one, the SLA will be using the SLA configurations for the new Priority. However, it will not start-over the counting of time based on the priority. It will be nice if it's possible for the SLA time to start-over as the issue may be assigned to different assingees on different priorities.

A use-case scenario:
# Issue created with priority _Medium_, status = New, SLA Resolution time will start based on the _Medium_ priority. The target is 2 hour
# Issue transitioned through several statuses, 1 hour and 30 minutes elapsed
# Once the issue priority changed to _High_, SLA Resolution time start-over counting from the beginning, target is 1 hour (new target), time elapsed = 0
# Issue transitioned through several statuses, 20 minutes elapsed
# Issue priority changed to _Medium_, status = any, 30 minutes is remaining to meet target of the SLA Resolution time for _Medium_ which is 2 hours.
fields.summary: Configure the SLA's to start-over once the priority is changed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-397].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JSD Source code is still not available in my.atlassian.com . This causes customer couldn’t review the source code .

h3. Suggested Solution
Make JSD Source Code available to be download in my.atlassian.com
fields.summary: As an administrator , would like to have JSD source code available to be download
Long rows in comments with block formatting break out of the page
Allow to show/hide "Create account" text in login page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-393].
  {panel}

On the "My Requests" screen in the customer portal, users can only see description and status.  This is quite limiting, especially where a user has a number of issues open and needs to discuss with support.

Some of our clients have 20+ issues open, and want to run through their list with a support rep - only having the description to go on makes running through the list quite tedious.

As a minimum, the Jira Issue key should be displayed alongside each issue.  

But (better still) a portal administrator should be able to choose what fields to show/hide on the "My requests" view, as you can with filters in in Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Allow customer portal users to see Issue Key in "My Requests"
Knowledge Base search result links are not clickable if the Confluence Like Plugin is disabled in Confluence
Allow URL In Signup Not Public Translation
Ability to search by reference ID in Customer Portal
ServiceDesk bypass application access in OnDemand for notification
No notifications for issues not created via Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-386].
  {panel}

We have a very limited tight set of permission schemes which are shared among hundreds of projects, and we use project roles to manage these permissions.

The People feature makes administration of such an instance harder. 

We spent considerable time cleaning up *project roles* so we can make it simple for users to understand what each one does. The People update exposes two new roles globally.

It also allows users to migrate to their own custom permission scheme. We can't fragment our hundreds of projects into their own permission schemes.

JSD-116 had a similar affect in allowing users to create new customfields via SLAs instead of encouraging re-use.
fields.summary: New People feature shouldn't perform changes that affect project roles/permission schemes
Error Message while trying to configure the customer portal of a service desk created from an existing project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-383].
  {panel}

We use, and like, the Service Desk reports feature, e.g. to see graphs of time to first resolution.

Currently, where you hover over a point on the graph it shows you how many issues were included (see attached screenshot).  It would be even better if you could click to drill through and see what the underlying issues were.

i.e. I can currently see that we had 12 beaches on 17th feb, but i can't see what they were, which doesn't help me with the root cause analysis.

thanks,
Mark.
fields.summary: As a service desk report viewer i want to click through from the graph to see underlying issues
Create an 'Ask a Question in Confluence' experience in JSD
Allow a JSD ticket to be converted to a Confluence Question
